note: Frozen – do not edit, only extend

items.description: A pattern of prolonged physical, mental, or emotional exhaustion caused by overextension, pressure, or lack of recovery.
Feeling unable to influence one’s life direction, decisions, or outcomes despite effort.
Taking excessive responsibility for others, systems, or outcomes at the cost of self-needs.
Avoiding change or risk primarily due to fear of loss, failure, or collapse.
Unclear sense of self, values, or direction, often shaped by external expectations.
Habitually minimizing or ignoring personal needs to maintain harmony or function.
Persistent tension or vigilance even when no immediate threat is present.
Past losses or endings that continue to affect present behavior or emotions.
A sense that life actions lack purpose or internal justification.
Gradual loss of vitality, confidence, or identity through repeated compromise.
